column4: <RussianPhysicsGu>did you try to use adept gui, search for usb, install ?
no, I'll go install Adept manager and get back to you, thanks
what should I be looking for in the package list?

I did that, and there's a list of packages that contain the term "usb" in their description - is there a specific one you recommend, or should I just get one that looks relevant? (usbmount looks like it might be it)
alright, I'll get those three and get back to you, thanks so much!
I'm still not entirely sure what I'm doing, I don't see any change in how it's behaving
Bus 005 Device 014: ID 041e:4128 Creative Technology, Ltd NOMAD Jukebox Zen Xtra (mtp)
lsusb is just the command that lists all usb devices attached. That's the issue: it sees that it's there, but I can't get it to mount
OH, there's a package for nomads! awesome!
that ï»¿sudo vi /etc/hotplug/usb/nomadjukebox.usermap command just gives me a blank terminal screen with a bunch of tildes (~)
alright, it's just a matter of figuring out how to configure gnomad2, I think i can figure it out from here
thanks so much for your help!
awesome. I think I actually just got it working with gnomad
well, gnomad recognizes its presence, and now it's just a matter of fiddling with that til it works
I should be fine from here, thanks again.
